results.headline: Review: In ‘Meet the Patels,’ a Son Submits to a Marriage Quest
results.summary_short: In this documentary, the wisecracking son of Indian-born parents agrees to look for a spouse with a similar background.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Meet the Patels

results.headline: Review: ‘Breathe,’ the Story of a Scary Teenage Romance
results.summary_short: This movie by Mélanie Laurent conveys insight into the psychology of late adolescence, when childhood fantasies can combust with adult sexuality.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Breathe

results.headline: Review: Annaud’s ‘Wolf Totem,’ Set in Inner Mongolia in the 1960s
results.summary_short: The landscape and painstakingly trained wolves are the true stars of this film, which focuses on a student who leaves Beijing to teach in a remote village during the Cultural Revolution.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Wolf Totem

results.headline: Review: ‘A Brilliant Young Mind’ Facing Infinite Obstacles
results.summary_short: A young mathematical genius played by Asa Butterfield struggles with his autism and the aftermath of his father’s death.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of A Brilliant Young Mind

results.headline: Review: ‘90 Minutes in Heaven,’ Then a Long Road Back
results.summary_short: This movie, based on a best-selling memoir, dwells on the physical and spiritual recovery of Don Piper, a Texas pastor who was declared dead in a car crash.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of 90 Minutes in Heaven

results.headline: Review: Richard Gere in ‘Time Out of Mind,’ a Life Adrift on the Margins
results.summary_short: This film is an intimate portrait of a man caught between the desire to be left alone and a need for human connection.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Time Out of Mind

results.headline: Review: ‘Welcome to Leith,’ a Documentary About a Town Fighting a Racist Takeover
results.summary_short: This documentary charts how a tiny North Dakota town united to block a racist’s plan to turn their enclave into a haven for white supremacists.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Welcome to Leith

results.headline: Review: In ‘Coming Home,’ a Family Rocked by the Cultural Revolution
results.summary_short: Amid the Cultural Revolution, a father is imprisoned, his teenage daughter denounces him, and a family tries to recover from that pain in this film by Zhang Yimou.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Coming Home

results.headline: Review: In ‘La Jaula de Oro,’ Riding the Rails to Reach New Lives
results.summary_short: Diego Quemada-Diez’s film follows three Guatemalan teenagers as they make their way through Mexico to the United States border.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Golden Dream

results.headline: Review: In ‘Blind,’ Perception and Fantasy Converge in a Writer’s Mind
results.summary_short: A Norwegian woman who recently lost her sight struggles to keep in touch with the visual world in Eskil Vogt’s debut feature.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Blind

results.headline: In ‘A Sinner in Mecca,’ a Gay Director Ponders His Sexuality and Islamic Faith
results.summary_short: In this documentary, Parvez Sharma considers the contradiction with his religion while on a pilgrimage in Saudi Arabia.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of A Sinner in Mecca

results.headline: Review: ‘The Transporter Refueled’ Has a New Guy Behind the Wheel
results.summary_short: Jason Statham sits out the fourth installment of this series, and the main returning cast member is a souped-up Audi.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Transporter Refueled

results.headline: Review: In ‘Contracted: Phase II’ Misfortune Multiples an Encounter at a Time
results.summary_short: This splatterfest directed by Josh Forbes wastes no time picking up where 2013’s “Contracted” left off.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Contracted: Phase II

results.headline: Review: In Chris Evans’s ‘Before We Go,’ a Chance Encounter With Staying Power
results.summary_short: Mr. Evans’s directorial debut is a modest, briskly paced actors’ film about strangers who meet in Grand Central Terminal in the early-morning hours.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Before We Go

results.headline: Review: ‘Dragon Blade’ Features Jackie Chan, Romans and a Lot of Mayhem
results.summary_short: This eyeball-popping extravaganza features Jackie Chan, John Cusack, Adrien Brody and lots of horse-riding extras.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Dragon Blade

results.headline: Review: ‘Dirty Weekend,’ Neil LaBute’s Tale of an Unexpected Layover
results.summary_short: Matthew Broderick and Alice Eve play colleagues stranded in Albuquerque who try to piece together what happened the last time one of them was there.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Dirty Weekend

results.display_title: Steve Jobs: The Man in the Machine
results.headline: Review: Different Thinking About Steve Jobs, the Man Behind Apple
results.summary_short: Alex Gibney’s new documentary, subtitled “The Man in the Machine,” is a merciless anatomy of a complicated public character.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Steve Jobs: The Man in the Machine

results.headline: Review: ‘Chloe & Theo,’ a Climate-Change Movie With Rising Levels of Simplicity
results.summary_short: This fanciful tale centers on an Inuit who makes friends with a Manhattan runaway and tries to warn the United Nations about the continuing destruction of the planet.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Chloe & Theo

results.display_title: The Black Panthers: Vanguard of the Revolution
results.headline: Review: ‘The Black Panthers’ Captures a Militant Movement’s Soul and Swagger
results.summary_short: Stanley Nelson’s new documentary chronicles the organization’s rise and turbulent times.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Black Panthers: Vanguard of the Revolution

results.headline: Review: ‘Creep,’ a Horror Film With the Look of Found Footage
results.summary_short: The actor and director Mark Duplass stars as a man seeking to leave a legacy for his unborn child.
